channel.title: San Diego Reader events
channel.description: San Diego Reader events - Showing the next 50 events

item.title: Sun 3/15: Temecula St. Patrick's Day 5K & 15K
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 7:30 a.m. to 11 a.m.

Where: Cougar Vineyard & Winery, 39870 De Portola Road, Temecula, CA

Cost: $30 - $60

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Third annual event. Race through country roads and vineyards as you wind your way to the finish line and a glass of green champagne in honor of St. Patrick’s Day.</p>

<p>Race entry includes a champagne tasting and a signature glass to keep. This is a challenging, hilly course, so be prepared for an exhilarating run. A portion of the proceeds go to the Rose Again Foundation.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Spring Garden Festival & Tomatomania
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Where: San Diego Botanic Garden, 230 Quail Gardens Drive, Encinitas

Cost: $8 - $14

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>The San Diego Botanic Garden hosts a Spring Garden Festival and Tomatomania featuring a variety of herbs, spring plants, bromeliads, garden art and implements, and of course tomatoes.

Garden experts will be on hand to answer questions and provide advice on spring plantings and caring for your garden. Food will be available from Divine Fresh, with musical entertainment from Bob Ballentine and friends. Don't miss this petting zoo and pony rides.

Scott Daigre is the guest speaker. Scott is an avid gardener, sometimes farmer, and landscape designer/owner of Powerplant Garden Design. Scott is happiest when showcasing rare and classic tomato varieties as owner and producer of Tomatomania, the world’s largest tomato-seedling sale. He’s just finished a new book that will teach new gardeners and accomplished veterans a thing or two about growing tomatoes.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Borrego Springs: Circle of Art Show & Sale
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: Christmas Circle, Palm Canyon Drive at Borrego Springs Road, Borrego Springs

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Enjoy the original work of more than 60 of the region's finest artisans representing a variety of media and experience the unique beauty of "California's Secret Desert" at this 26th annual event.</p>

<p>At Christmas Circle, the grassy park in the center of Borrego Springs. The two-day show includes music and food.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Scrivener 101: An Introduction
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 9 a.m. to noon

Where: The Ink Spot, 2730 Historic Decatur Road, Barracks 16 #202, San Diego

Cost: $45 - $54

Age limit: 18+

Description: If you’ve considered looking for an alternative to MS Word but wondered whether it would be worth the time to learn a new program, this class is for you.

This course is an introduction to Scrivener, the best writing software application for Mac or PC. Scrivener was designed by a writer who needed a better tool to manage the complexity of writing a novel. It is a feature rich application that helps authors organize the researching, outlining, writing, and revising of a novel, long work of non-fiction, or screenplay. Because of its ability to compile to multiple formats, Scrivener can also be used for blog posts, poetry, and articles.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Children's Illustrator Gives Workshop
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: USD: University of San Diego, 5998 Alcalá Park, San Diego

Cost: $65 - $140

Age limit: 18+

Description: E.B. Lewis will lead a hands-on intensive workshop during his visit to San Diego.

This six-hour intensive will cover every aspect of the process of making picture books, with a focus on:
• Creating the hook of the book
• Referencing
• Working research
• Creating images that build a story

Lewis has years of experience teaching illustrators and his own unique approach based on illustrations as a visual language.<br><br>This schedule is as follows:
9 a.m. – 12 p.m. – Morning Session
12 -1 p.m. – Networking Potluck Lunch
1 – 4 p.m. – Afternoon Session

Participants are asked to bring a sketchbook, pencils, camera and something to share for the potluck lunch. (A small refrigerator and microwave will be available).<br><br>This illustrator intensive workshop will take place at USD’s Hahn School of Nursing Building (Linda Vista Road and Marion Way). Registration: 619-713-5462.<br><br>The Society of Children’s Book Writers and Illustrators is an international organization serving writers and illustrators of children’s literature, including books, magazines, educational material, plays, electronic media and film. SCBWI facilitates networking and information exchange amongst writers, illustrators, editors, publishers, literary agents, librarians, educators, booksellers and others involved with literature for young people. The San Diego chapter covers the San Diego region and is one of the most active chapters in the country.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Restore Native Habitat
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 9:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

Where: Mariner's Point, Mariners Way, San Diego

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Manage invasive plants in Mission Bay to protect endangered birds.</p>

<p>San Diego Audubon is working to remove invasive plants from Mariner’s Point. Our goal is to promote nesting by the California Least Tern (an endangered species) and to create space for native coastal dune plants.</p>

<p>Meet at the parking lot at the end of Mariner’s Way in Mission Bay. Info: hirt@sandiegoaudubon.org or 858-273-7800 x106.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Leapin’ Lizards
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 9:30 a.m. to 11 a.m.

Where: Mission Trails Regional Park, One Father Junípero Serra Trail, San Carlos, CA

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Spring wildflowers and associated polinators invite accelerated lizard activity.</p>

<p>A fun morning stroll with a Mission Trails Regional Park trail guide is the ideal time to travel "lizard-land" and learn fun facts about life among sage and chaparral. Meet inside Visitor Center.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Fallbrook World Music Festival
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Where: Smog Bros, 418 W. Aviation, Fallbrook

Cost: Free - $20

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>The lineup includes Raiz Musik, Sol Remedy, Revival, the Fallbrook Vigilantes and the Fallbrook Kid, SM Familia, Piracy, and DJs Carlos Culture, Jdawg , and Chris Red Rose.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: St. Patrick's Day Parade and Block Party
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: Vista Village Pub, 224 Main Street, Vista

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Fourth Annual North County St. Patrick's Day Parade and Block Party.</p>

<p>This year's Grand Marshall is Elena Gomez, a San Diego NBC reporter and former Miss Vista. This year’s parade theme is “Honoring First Responders” with free entry for any paramedic, police, or fire unit.</p>

<p>Awards will be given for “Best Irish Theme,” “Best 30 Second Performance,” “Best Irish Dog,” and “Best Service Group.” Music  by the Lacemakers from noon to 4 pm.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Marine Science Day
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: Coastal and Marine Institute Laboratory, 4165 Spruance Road, San Diego

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Meet marine biologists and scientists, interact with sea creatures, and learn about San Diego’s diverse marine ecosystems.</p>

<p>This is a once-a-year opportunity when CMIL opens its doors to the public and a rare chance to experience what goes on at a working marine research laboratory. This event will showcase marine research conducted by SDSU faculty and students and provide public educational and outreach activities related to marine science and conservation and local marine ecosystems.</p>

<p>Throughout the day there will be interactive kid-friendly activities, research talks by students and faculty, games, a marine-life touch tank, SCUBA gear demonstrations, raffles, and more.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Bread Basics
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.

Where: Sur la Table, 1905 Calle Barcelona, Carlsbad

Cost: $69

Age limit: Not available

Description: <p>Enjoy a warm slice of artisan bread fresh from your very own oven. This
class will walk you through preparing and baking a variety of artisan
favorites like sourdough, focaccia, and baguettes. You'll learn
time-tested and time-saving techniques that make good breads great every
time.
<br></p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Wild Older Women
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m.

Where: Rebecca's Coffee House, 3015 Juniper Street, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

Description: <p>This is a morning event.<br></p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Scot Taber
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m.

Where: Sea & Smoke, 2690 Via de la Valle, No. D210, Del Mar

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

item.title: Sun 3/15: Brunch for Justice
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.

Where: Carlsbad Senior Center, 799 Pine Avenue, Carlsbad

Cost: $10

Age limit: All ages

Description: The North County Islamic Foundation and the Council on American-Islamic Relations, San Diego Chapter, present "A Brunch For Justice."

Speakers include Hassan Shibly, Executive Director of CAIR-Florida, and Tareq Khdeir, an American teenager beaten up by Israeli authorities in 2014. Lunch is included, along with an interfaith panel on the topic of justice. Info: 760-681-0755.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Summit in Zimbabwe
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10 a.m. to noon

Where: Summit Unitarian Universalist Fellowship, 8778 Cottonwood Avenue, Santee

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Alix Hart and Mark Wheeler -- members of Summit’s Social Action Committee -- will provide an update on the charitable work they are doing in Zimbabwe as leaders of the San Diego based Compassion for African Villages.</p>

<p>CAV is a nonprofit all-volunteer charitable organization dedicated to working with African villagers to develop sustainable equitable educational resources. CAV was started in June of 2007 by the late Ms. Tsitsi Mutseta in order to raise awareness of the problems faced by impoverished villagers in Africa and to help solve those problems.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Tall Ship Adventure Cruise: Sea Shanties
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10:30 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Where: Schooner Bill of Rights, 604 Marina Parkway, Chula Vista

Cost: $20 - $50

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Experience the adventure of sailing on the 136 ft. schooner <em>Bill of Rights</em>. Join us for an all-day sail up the bay to the ocean and back in time for a beautiful sunset.</p>

<p>Enjoy a view of the South Bay boat yards, the Coronado bridge, the Midway, downtown, Point Loma, and the Pacific Ocean. Sit back and enjoy, or pitch in and help raise the sails!</p>

<p>This week's adventure will feature the sea shanty music of sailing days past.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: The Prinicple
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 10:40 a.m. to 11 p.m.

Where: AMC Mission Valley, 1640 Camino del Rio North, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: All ages

Description: <em>The Principle </em>brings to light new scientific observations challenging the Copernican Principle, the foundational assumption underlying the modern scientific world view. The idea that the Earth occupies no special or favored position in the cosmos has launched the last two scientific revolutions -- the Copernican Revolution and Relativity -- and, as Lawrence Krauss has said, we could be on the verge of a third, with "Copernicus coming back to haunt us."

Interviews with leading cosmologists are interspersed with the views of dissidents and mavericks, bringing into focus the challenges and implications not only for cosmology but for our cultural and religious view of reality.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Wedding Show
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.

Where: U.S. Grant Hotel, 326 Broadway, San Diego

Cost: $45

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Taste pastries from Provence to Paris, learn the art of the tango and flamenco dancing from Spain, and enjoy a three-course plated lunch prepared by the US Grant Executive Chef.</p>

<p>Concludes with a fashion show presented by M Bride featuring bridal couture and the exclusive California launch of Ines Di Santo's eveningwear collection with an introduction by Di Santo and giveaway for one bride to win a Di Santo couture gown.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Knuffle Bunny: A Cautionary Musical
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

Where: North Coast Repertory Theatre, 987-D Lomas Santa Fe Drive, Solana Beach

Cost: $18

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Based on the childrens book by Mo Willems, this family friendly musical follows Trixie, her father, and her favorite stuffed bunny on an exciting adventure to the laundromat.</p>

<p>All is fun until two-year old Trixie realizes she has left her Knuffle Bunny there. She tries everything to make her father understand the problem, but he just doesnt speak "toddler." Filled with music and lively action. Directed by Benjamin Cole.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Acoustic Brunch with Chris Bianco
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.

Where: Hill Street Cafe & Gallery, 524 S. Coast Highway 101, 4, Oceanside

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

item.title: Sun 3/15: Kirk Franklin presents Gospel Brunch
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 11 a.m.

Where: House of Blues, 1055 Fifth Avenue, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: All ages

item.title: Sun 3/15: Marcela Mendez
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 11 a.m.

Where: Searsucker Del Mar, 12995 El Camino Real, Del Mar

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

item.title: Sun 3/15: Tall Ship Adventure Aboard the Californian
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 11:30 a.m. to 3 p.m.

Where: San Diego Maritime Museum, 1492 N. Harbor Drive, San Diego

Cost: $40 - $60

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>The Californian is a replica of a gold rush era revenue cutter and the Official Tall Ship of the State of California.</p>

<p>Join the crew in sailing a traditionally rigged tall ship. Passengers are invited to haul a line, man the helm, and end their day with a cannon salute. Watch the crew as they scamper up and down the rigging to set and furl the sails. Listen as the Californian's crew relates the history of sailing and exploration in San Diego, tales of whaling and the sea otter trade, local sea battles, the art of ship's gunnery, and life at sea.</p>

<p>Check-in ends at 11:30 am. There is no late boarding, but you can check-in as early as 9 am and enjoy the museum before your sail.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Danny Ryan: Structure
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, noon to 5 p.m.

Where: Exclusive Collections Gaslamp Quarter, 437 Market Street, San Diego

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Check out artist Danny Ryan during his "Structure" art show.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Sunday Fun Day
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, noon to 4 p.m.

Where: Barefoot Bar and Grill, 1404 Vacation Road, San Diego

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

item.title: Sun 3/15: Sunday Funday
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, noon

Where: 98 Bottles, 2400 Kettner Boulevard, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

item.title: Sun 3/15: STEAM Family Day
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, noon to 5 p.m.

Where: Mingei International Museum, 1439 El Prado, San Diego

Cost: $5

Age limit: All ages

Description: Every third Sunday of the month is Family Sunday at Mingei. Come and explore the Museum’s colorful exhibitions, make an art project, go on a treasure hunt throughout the Museum, talk to a docent and take home prizes, all for a discounted admission rate of $5 for the entire family.

This month's Family Sunday is STEAM Family Day, focusing on architecture and adornment. Create handmade beads from recycled materials and see guest artist Christy Oates demonstrate her process of digital making combined with traditional woodworking techniques. Experience the Museum's current exhibitions, including <i>Black Dolls</i> and <i>Three on the Edge,</i> showcasing the architectural works of three local designers. 619-704-7527.

item.title: Sun 3/15: 22nd San Diego Latino Film Festival
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, noon to 11 p.m.

Where: AMC Fashion Valley, 7037 Friars Road, San Diego

Cost: $11.50 - $45

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>The San Diego Latino Film Festival (SDLFF) is an 11-day juried film/video exhibition of work celebrating Latino artists and Latino genre. The festival hosts guest filmmakers’ appearances, workshops, live music, art exhibitions, and gala celebrations.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: The Yes Team
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, noon

Where: Herringbone, 7837 Herschel Avenue, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

item.title: Sun 3/15: Casey Turner
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, noon

Where: Union Kitchen & Tap Gaslamp, 333 Fifth Avenue, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

item.title: Sun 3/15: CRSSD Festival
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 12:30 p.m. to 11 p.m.

Where: Waterfront Park, 1600 Pacific Highway, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

Description: Co-produced by Goldenvoice and local promoter CRSSD FNGRS, the festival will feature Chromeo, Classixx, DJ Harvey, Flight Facilities, Robert DeLong, and Empire of the Sun, along with DJs like Jamie Jones, Hot Natured, Pete Tong, Seth Troxler, Lee Burridge, and Maceo Plex.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Painting & Vino: "Feathery Wave"
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 12:30 p.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Where: 98 Bottles, 2400 Kettner Boulevard, San Diego

Cost: $45

Age limit: 21+

Description: Recreate "Feathery Wave" while sipping wine or cocktails. Supplies (canvas, paints, brushes, apron) included. No experience necessary. Registration required.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Family Drop-In Day: Exploring Shape and Form
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 1 p.m. to 3 p.m.

Where: San Diego Museum of Art, 1450 El Prado, San Diego

Cost: Free - $12

Age limit: All ages

Description: Offered every Sunday, Family Drop-In Days feature family friendly, docent-led tours, gallery games, and art projects for families to complete together.

Activities are suitable for all ages and skill levels and center around a specific theme. Art projects change weekly and themes change monthly. Children must be accompanied by an adult. Free with museum admission.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Open Farm Tour: Oasis Camel Dairy
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 1 p.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: Oasis Camel Dairy, 26700 Highway 78, Ramona

Cost: $7 - $10

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>This 32-acre working ranch and camel milk dairy is home to a large herd of camels, donkeys, horses, sheep, dogs, cats, turkeys, and exotic birds.</p>

<p>Oasis Camel Dairy opens its doors each month for an open farm tour where the public can learn about, ride, feed, and pet camels and catch the Camel Dairy Life Show (at 1:30 pm sharp!) with hosts Gil and Nancy Riegler and their furry and feathery friends. Info: oasiscameldairy@gmail.com.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Wine and Canvas: Ladybug Love Family Event
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 1 p.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: Hard Rock Café, 801 Fourth Avenue, San Diego

Cost: $35

Age limit: 18+

Description: Ages eight and up welcome. Guests under age 18 must be registered with accompanying registered adult. No experience necessary. Our local artist will guide you step-by-step as you recreate a featured painting. Ticket includes a 16"x20" canvas, easel, paint, brushes, and apron.

item.title: Sun 3/15: DJ Billy the Kid
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 1 p.m.

Where: Uptown Tavern, 1236 University Avenue, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

item.title: Sun 3/15: Recycle Me: Sock Puppets
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 1:30 p.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Where: Oceanside Museum of Art, 704 Pier View Way, Oceanside

Cost: $10 - $12

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Bring in your lonely single sock and turn it into a fantastic sock puppet.</p>

<p>Does your washing machine or clothes dryer eat your socks, leaving just one? Or maybe it’s the dog. This is the opportunity you’ve been waiting for! Don’t worry, if you don’t have a sock you can have one of ours. Ticket includes one adult and two children, age five and up.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Pioneers of the Right-to-Die Movement
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 1:30 p.m. to 3 p.m.

Where: Scottish Rite Center, 1895 Camino del Rio South, San Diego

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: Hear Derek Humphry, founder of the Hemlock Society, Richard MacDonald, M.D., medical director, Hemlock Society, and Faye Girsh, Ed.D, founder and president Hemlock Society of San Diego, discuss the past and future of the right-to-die movement.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Charlotte's Web
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m.

Where: Maxine Theater, 31322 Cole Grade Road, Valley Center

Cost: $15 - $18

Age limit: Not available

Description: <p>In the stage adaption of this children’s literature classic, audience members will find themselves on the Zuckerman farm with Wilbur and his barnyard friends. As a piglet, Wilbur was a runt and had to be rescued from an uncertain future by the farmer’s niece, Fern. Now he is enjoying life on the farm with a family of geese, a mischievous rat, and a friendly spider named Charlotte.</p>

<p>As Wilbur grows, the runt he once was is a thing of the past and Charlotte quickly works up a plan to keep her dear friend from becoming dinner. Don’t miss the fun as these animals place their farm in the spotlight and use their friendship to help Wilbur become the most famous pig in history.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: La Jolla Symphony & Chorus
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: Mandeville Auditorium at UCSD, 9500 Gilman Drive, San Diego

Cost: $18 - $36

Age limit: All ages

Description: Steven Schick leads chorus, orchestra, guest soloist, and guest chorus in three performances of Hector Berlioz’s “Requiem.” With a chorus of 180, including the 60-voice Gay Men’s Chorus, large orchestra, four brass bands, and tenor soloist John Tirrano, “Requiem” is a spectacle to behold, as well as Berlioz’s most heartfelt music. Pre-concert lecture given by Steven Schick one hour prior to concert times. Please note: parking is free on Saturday and Sunday, but a fee is required on Friday evening.

item.title: Sun 3/15: Matt Smith Neu Jazz Trio
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.

Where: 98 Bottles, 2400 Kettner Boulevard, San Diego

Cost: Free

Age limit: 21+

item.title: Sun 3/15: Outdoor Organ Concert
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m.

Where: Spreckels Organ Pavilion, 1549 El Prado, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

Description: <p>The San Diego Organ Society presents a free organ concert.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: The Music Man Jr.
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m.

Where: Mission Hills United Church of Christ, 4070 Jackdaw Street, San Diego

Cost: $9 - $12

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Center Stage Children’s Theater first  production of the toe-tapping, rib-tickling, musical extravaganza <em>The Music Man Jr</em>., based on the book by Meredith Wilson turned five-time Tony Award winner and Broadway smash.</p>

<p>The story follows the charismatic con-artist Harold Hill, a traveling-salesmen who charms the townsfolk of River City into starting up a kids marching band. His scam? Harold plans to take the townsfolks money and run.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Grayson Tucker
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.

Where: Cafe Panini, 505 Oak Ave. #C, Carlsbad, California 92008, Carlsbad

Cost: Not available

Age limit: Not available

item.title: Sun 3/15: American Girl Fashion Show
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m.

Where: Irwin M Jacobs Qualcomm Hall, 5775 Morehouse Drive, San Diego

Cost: $35 - $100

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Scripps Performing Arts Academy invites you to the American Girl Fashion Show.</p>

<p>This program showcases historical and contemporary fashions for girls and their dolls. Between 50 to 100 local models will present the fashions with historical clothing -- from daywear to sleepwear to special-occasion clothing -- that resembles what the popular American Girl characters Kaya, Caroline, Josefina, Addy, Rebecca, Kit, and Julie might have worn. With contemporary “Just Like You” outfits for older girls and Little Girl fashions for little ones, refreshments, party favors, a raffle, and door prizes.</p>

<p>Proceeds benefit Isabella’s Giraffe Club, a 501c(3) non-profit that supports the infants in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit at UCSD Medical Center. General admission includes one raffle ticket; $100 VIP includes seating in the first three rows and five raffle tickets Info: 858-509-2624.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Alice: Curiouser and Curiouser!
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m.

Where: Don Powell Theatre at SDSU, 5500 Campanile Drive, San Diego

Cost: $14 - $16

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>To celebrate the 150th anniversary of the publication of Alice's adventures in Wonderland, SDSU Theatre presents Lewis Carroll's <em>Alice in Wonderland </em>and <em>Through the Looking Glass</em>, adapted and directed by Margaret Larlham as an "ecclectic mix of Victorian and modern sensibilities."</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Allison Adams Tucker
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m.

Where: Cole Library, 1250 Carlsbad Village Drive, Carlsbad

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Tucker sings in six languages including Italian, French, Japanese, and Spanish.</p>

item.title: Sun 3/15: The Drowsy Chaperone
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: MiraCosta College, One Barnard Drive, Oceanside

Cost: $10 - $15

Age limit: All ages

Description: A musical-inside-a-comedy is for those who love musical theatre and those who don’t care for it at all! Tracy Williams will direct. <i>The Drowsy Chaperone</i> begins with Man in Chair, alone in his shabby apartment pining for the good old days of Broadway when suddenly his favorite 1920’s musical bursts to life in his very own living room. A glamorous, hilarious tale of a celebrity bride and her outrageous wedding day, complete with thrills and surprises. “Everything always works out in musicals,” says Man in Chair. “In the real world, nothing ever works out and the only people who burst into song are hopelessly deranged.”<br><br>The cast features Andrew Layton as Man in Chair. Other cast members are Matthew Abosamra, Melissa Bonilla, Timothy Cabal, Travis Charron, Rachel Dillon, Kyle Dowdy, Steve Garretson, Rachael Hodge, Janey Hurley, Madison Lewis, Reden Magtira, Jason Marks, Brent Perkins, Joseph Prete, David Sherlock, Ala Tiatia, Christopher Walters, Maggie Willett and Lainey Woo.<br><br>Tickets: miracosta.edu/buytix or 760-795-6815.<br>

item.title: Sun 3/15: Jonny Tarr
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m.

Where: The Tipsy Crow, 770 Fifth Avenue, San Diego

Cost: Not available

Age limit: 21+

item.title: Sun 3/15: People's Climate March & Rally
item.description:
When: Sunday, March 15, 2015, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.

Where: San Diego City Hall Plaza, Third Avenue and C Street

Cost: Free

Age limit: All ages

Description: <p>Rally at City Hall Plaza and then march to Federal building to petition the U.S. Government to immediately commence a national World War II-style mobilization to transition the U.S. from fossil fuels to renewable energy.</p>

<p>Supported by San Diego Labor Council, Sierra Club, Greenpeace, The Environmental Health Coalition, the Peace Resource Center, Activist San Diego, San Diego 350, Citizen Climate Lobby, the San Diego Democratic Party, Ocean Beach People's Food Co-op, Women Occupy, and various San Diego individuals. More info: Facebook: People's Climate Action Rally and Walk or email oceanbeachgreencenter@gmail.com.</p>
